Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: NickBkk
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night as we arrived in the evening to LAX and we needed to catch an early flight the following day. Waiting for the shuttle bus took a while, but the problem lies in the busy road around the arrival terminals that slow down all the traffic. Then, the shuttle will go first to the JW Marriot to drop and pick up other people and finally the Courtyard, so you should be patient with this arrangement. However going back to airport is very fast as the Hotel is very close to the Terminals. And this is a service that runs 24 hours, so it is much better than other properties than will not offer you a shuttle service at 5am. The room was good and most probably was renovated not long ago. There was plenty of space and a fridge that was handy to chill some water and other drinks. You could also buy some food and drinks in their hotel store, just opposite the main lobby. Overall, a good option in LAX area for short stopovers.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, easy access to the LA area”
Reviews.Author: AndreaRae13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty newly renovated and they have done a nice job. The rooms are large and clean and the bed is very comfortable. The walls seem pretty thin, but not abnormal for a hotel room. You are going to want earplugs if you are a light sleeper. I was on the second floor and the planes shook the windows on a regular basis. This was a perfect place for me to stay, easy access to Manhattan Beach and everywhere else I wanted to go (with my rental car). If you don't have a rental car there is a nice shuttle that will take you to Manhattan Beach. FYI, if you have a car they only offer valet which is about $20/night for guests (incl. tax). The valets were super friendly, even knew my name!

Reviews.Title: “Business Meetings @ Courtyard LAX”
Reviews.Author: Cat F
Reviews.Content: Had to pull together a 2-day dealer mtg in an accessible location. This fit the bill. Excellent service top to bottom, on both days, although sales person never bothered to introduce herself once I was onsite. Mtg room was adequate, but Tomas was fantastic, the A/V svc prompt/skilled, and the food very good. Negociated room rate was excellent, although my room could've been cleaner. Entire hotel is quiet, given its location. Free hotel shuttle was a godsend, and prompt. Two thumbs up on the whole!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: aaronmarko
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night here after a long flight. It's right at the LAX airport, staff is friendly, the room was large and comfortable. There's a no frills bistro where you can get a decent meal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice newly renovated hotel adjoining LAX.”
Reviews.Author: drfumblefinger
Reviews.Content: Courtyard hotels are not everyone's cup of tea but I enjoy their pragmatic design (built with the business traveler in mind) and overall comfort. This Courtyard has just completed a major renovation and it is a fresh and attractively remodeled hotel. The colors are new and vibrant. Rooms have nice amenities. staff was very friendly and attentive. Our room was very quiet and we had a good (but short) night's sleep. Didn't eat here so couldn't comment on this. Free shuttle leaves for LAX every 15 minutes, a very helpful feature. Parking is very limited and expensive if you bring a car as it's limited and all valet, but if you just want an overnight before heading out early in the morning this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hernandezmm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and very clean. Food is great. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best LAX hotel, by YARDS! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kawoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 3 different LAX properties this week and the Courtyard Marriott Lax/Century Blvd (not to be confused with the one in El Segundo) is great. It's close to the airport (in fact you can walk to it in 10 minutes, it's next to the Radisson). The hotel is completely renovated or brand new - new gym equipment, fully brand new rooms, free tea/coffee in the morning, great deli downstairs and cafe - deli is 24 hours. Checkin quick, efficent. Shuttle every 10-15 mins. Free internet. What more could you ask for - this is what an airport hotel should be and more. Definitely worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has plush, well appointed, spacious room, in-room FREE Internet, great location by LAX, FREE shuttle to/from airport”
Reviews.Author: Peterskis
Reviews.Content: Review on Marriott Courtyard, LAX http://www.h-rez.com/a138136/index.htm?lbl=ggl-en My wife and I stayed one night at this charming hotel by the Los Angeles Airport, to catch a flight out of LAX to the Far East the next morning. We loved our beautifully appointed, spacious room, its convenient location, and the free shuttle bus service to/from the hotel/airport.Â  THE HOTEL The hotel entrance/lobby are quiteÂ small, but comfortable and functional,Â with a food/beverage bar, and a small bistro bar.Â Our room is one of the recently rennovated: - spacious and beautifully appointed,Â inviting and comfortable. It also comes with free internet, both wired and wireless.Â  SERVICE: - The bell/porter was very friendly, andÂ helpful with luggages. The shuttle bus drivers were cheerful, humorous, and very helpful getting our luggages on/off the shuttle bus.Â  This hotel was excellent, EXCEPT FOR ONE BAD EXPERIENCE with the hotel check-in staff (only one on duty around 7:30pm that evening). He was disinterested and impersonal checking us in; non-responsive to our questions on hotel amenities - and talking on the phone before completing our check-in! We were the only guests at check in and he made us feel unwelcome. Fortunately, our bell/porter was very nice, who told us about the hotel amenities and the neighborhood area. The check-out staff (two) in the morning were cheerful and efficient, however. - Overall, we like this hotel, especially its new room, FREE internet and free shuttle service. Peterskis, Jan 2012 ---

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Rooms are newly renovated, clean, flat screen HD TV and complimentary wireless WI FI that worked perfectly. In the four nights I never heard a sound from the other rooms. Once in a while heard jet noise but it was sporadic and didn't disturb me. Biggest negative was housekeeping. One day we left the room and did not return until 4 pm and the room was not serviced. I had to call housekeeping for service. The next day we had the do not disturb sign on the door. I heard housekeeping across the hall and asked if they could just take the garbage and change towels. The two employees said I had to call housekeeping. To just get towels and take the garbage?? Bull!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice near LAX”
Reviews.Author: p8patyger
Reviews.Content: There are free shuttles to and from the airport. They've stations in the lobby rather than a checkout counter which I find taking some getting used to. The restaurant has decent fare but has restricted hours. There is no room service which could be problematic when there is not much within walking distance. Rooms are a good size. TV is HD. Wifi is not reliable. You've to keep logging on and off. The maid service is the worst I've ever experienced in a US hotel. Shampoo and conditioner are not replaced, to the point where I'd to request them from the front desk. Towels hung on the bar are not folded. You may or may not get a bath mat. Noise from the planes is not too bad but you can hear everything thru the walls from your neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night”
Reviews.Author: ryanpeg
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here - before flying home on an early morning flight. We got great help from the valet person and wonderful help at the mini-restaurant. Maria was very gracious! Rooms are large, clean and quiet. Shuttle seems to be a LAX generic one - it worked great at 5am!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nstock1283
Reviews.Content: The, only downfall was paying nightly for parking in the lot. They offer valet as wel but you're going to want to tack that onto daily expenses. The staff at the desk, the bar/restaurant and room attendants were all exceptionally welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: BianchiRoadie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close (2 mins) to the airport but set far enough back from Century Blvd to avoid a lot of the street noise that is common with other hotels in the area. Thick Windows kept out jet noise. This hotel is perfect for a one night stay before catching a flight or attending a business meeting, but would not recommend this part of town for vacationers. Lobby is recently remodeled and room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A big WOW !”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport. Fast and free shuttle, easy check in/out. Beautiful room dÃ©cor, spacious and clean... Fridge & coffee & microwave WiFi & HDTv Comfortable bed, nice furniture. Great stay ! Absolutely nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Best Courtyard Yet”
Reviews.Author: kpoconnor
Reviews.Content: I am Platinum Marriott Member. Stayed one night on business trip to catch early flight. Hotel is very close to airport. Shuttle is only for Marriott and Courtyard so wasnt to crowded in the morning but I'm sure that varies. Lobby looks to be newly renovated as do the rooms. Nice large rooms very clean and updated. HD TVs with typical selection of channels. Nice workspace. Bath rooms are a bit small as the sink is outside in the living area. Beds were VERY comfortable with quality linens. Eat dinner in the deli downstairs. Food was actually much better than I expected. Limited slection but pretty much something for everyone and prices not to bad. Not sure what I recieved as a Platinum member if anything but I would definetly stay here again as long as price is right! All the staff I spoke with were friendly and helpful. Dont remember if AC was central or wall unit as I never turned it on but slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable spot adjacent to airport”
Reviews.Author: Streamborne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used Marriott points to book two nights here while visiting friends in L.A., so I'm not entirely sure what the price/value would have been otherwise. But in any case the hotel lived up to typical Marriott standards. Our room was surprisingly quiet considering that the hotel is closer to LAX than any other hotel - we never noticed the plane traffic, which was not true at some other hotels we've stayed in near LAX. Service was good. It would be better if the airport shuttle departed at specified times instead of "every 20 minutes" - we just missed a departure and had to wait the full 20 minutes, then do the full circle around LAX to United gates, so we were uncomfortably close making our flight. Location is excellent for those who want the shortest possible shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: vutukuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 days on a business trip & this is nice hotel near the airport. The rooms were really spacious and great views of the busy LAX airport. We also used the business conference rooms during the stay and those were really set for business meetings. There are only limited choices for breakfast and the staff are really nice. There is only valet parking..so, you should plan about $16 per night :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Candizz
Reviews.Content: It was surprisingly close to the airport with a free shuttle every 15 mins. Extremely helpful front desk, and super friendly. I had actually booked with another courtyard also with a free shuttle from the airport. I hopped onto the Shuttle that said "courtyard" not knowing there were 2 by the airport. When I arrived I noticed it was the wrong one. Dragging one large luggage and 2 carryons I really wasnt in the mood to go back to the airport or pay for a taxi. I had told the front desk agent what had happened and she was super helpful and polite. She helped me switch the check in from the other one to this one to save me from moving back and forth considering i was only staying 1 night. That was extremely helpful of her, and I am still grateful. When I was looking for some food, I noticed the bistro was closed. However there is a subway next door, so i did not have a problem finding food. The room and the washroom was very clean and much bigger than I expected. Everything was comfortable and I was able to rest and relax after my flight. Great stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gander1955
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we're at LAX. The hotel is newly refurbished. The new Bistro is the perfect addition! It used to be that you had to eat before you got there or be satisfied with the "snack bar". The bistro is serving hot food till either 10 or 11 at night. Staff is always friendly. Rooms are large and will accommodate numerous pieces of luggage and still allow a person to move freely around the room. Valet only if you drive in. Double check, but I believe they also offer a park while you fly deal. On the shuttle bus line to LAX. Shuttle every 15 minutes. They are the last hotel on the shuttle line, while the bus is off the airport, and therefore when you board the bus here, you go straight to the airport terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport and Midway Car rental”
Reviews.Author: MHSG
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because I was returning a rental car next door and leaving from LAX the next morning. Also I am an Elite Marriott member but quite frankly got no particular recognition for that. The lobby is very attractive but the rather limited snack bar lead us to go out to eat in the evening and to go next door to the restaurant at the Radisson for breakfast the next day. The room was excellent - one of the largest chain hotel rooms I've seen and beautifully appointed. The shuttle to the airport was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: hopelove
Reviews.Content: the shuttle bus is a long wait.... the room was very nice and clean it was huge .. the shuttlbus never came. I hop into a taxi and the hotel reimburse my money.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Great Detractors”
Reviews.Author: naomimc
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a weekend seminar at this hotel. The biggest complaint I have is that at no time was I able to verify that my seminar was being held at that particular hotel. I even missed out on a non-refundable rate because the agent was uncomfortable booking me at a hotel where my seminar wasn't listed. I made no less than 6 phone calls to front desk personnel at the very hotel and even the Marriott down the street. I tried repeatedly to verify the location of the seminar with the hosts who were befuddled by the hotel's lack of information. I finally decided to give it a shot since I already had my airline reservation booked and paid for. Upon arrival the front desk clerk just laughed it off saying they should have checked the book. It added a lot of unnecessary stress and even cost to my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel for my layover”
Reviews.Author: elsal
Reviews.Content: I reserved a night at this Courtyard for a very reasonable price, $79, and I couldn't be more pleased with the value of the hotel stay. As stated by many others previously, it is very close by the entrance of the airport. Making it a very quick return to the terminal after my night's stay. Getting to the hotel from the airport is not as efficient, since the shuttle hits the Marriott first, and must negotiate a fair amount of traffic in and around the hotels. I'd say expect a 20 minute trip from the terminals to the hotel versus just 5 minutes... hotel to terminals. I had a top floor room that was attractive, very spacious, with plenty of workspace for my laptop, lots of electric outlets, and a very comfortable bed. The room was very clean. The bath had a tub. I used the downstairs "counter" for a quick bite of dinner and grabbed a few cocktails from there, too. It's a convenient and relatively cheap option for a simple nosh... soups, sandwiches, pizza, rotisserie chicken, etc. Nothing fancy, but perfect for a quick bite on the go. The check-in/out process was very quick and efficient at this very busy hotel. It's an ideal choice for a night's layover at LAX. A word of advice on hotel rates: Marriott guarantees their website's rates. So reserve on their site for your room, and if you happen to find a better rate on another website, fill out the online claim for on Marriott's site and they will match the rate plus give you an additional 25% discount. It's pays to shop around!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Courtyard, convenient to LAX & car rental returns”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of an LA vacation and was pleasantly surprised. The service was fine, the rooms were clean and large. There is a mini fridge and microwave in the room. Everything looked newly remodeled. Even though it is very close to LAX, I never heard the air traffic. It's a good value for the price. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good.”
Reviews.Author: travellerJack
Reviews.Content: Very spacious room. Very clean, with new furniture and appliances. Medium-level quality, but still very refreshing. Free wifi. Coffee in the room, a small cafeteria downstairs. Check in was a breeze, check out even faster. For one night near LAX, I would definitely stay here again. I waited less than 5 minutes for the shuttle, but other guests complained about a long wait. Also, I got this room for a really good rate through BRG so I may be biased. If you're renting a car, consider Midway: located just across the driveway from the Courtyard, I have nothing but praise for them. Low rates, brand new car and efficient, friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok, but holy cow, the WORST service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: ricedish
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of hotels around LAX airport, all around the same price point. Do yourself a favor and pick one other than the Courtyard Marriott. I wil say upfront that the rooms are okay. They are relatively new, and spacious enough. The quality of the amenities (soap, shampoo, etc) is pretty poor, but acceptable if you just need a place to stay for a layover (which is likely the case if you're staying by LAX). When it comes to service though, the rudest experience I've ever had, from almost everyone I encountered. The shuttles don't come regularly (don't believe for a moment the claim that it's one every 15 minutes). The guy at the valet is rude. Seems to be on his cell phone chatting (at least the three times that I tried to interact with him). The check-in staff are awful. Slow, incompetent, not at all pleasant. The managers are surly, and when I tried to make a complaint about the rest of the experience, were just plain nasty. I can accept a lot of things in order to have simplicity and proximity. However, what should have been just a short stay from the airport was just one delay after another, with nasty people to deal with on top. When you're already stressed from traveling, no need to deal with the extra aggravation from this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, modern and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: barleybo
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is especially reasonable on weekends, $99. Big rooms, flat screen, attractive. The only thing that is free is the shuttle bus to LAX and some coffee. Otherwise, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX But Too Many Issues for a Return”
Reviews.Author: ChiefDennis
Reviews.Content: Drive up to valet parking and got out of car. Waited as valet finished his ten-minute chat with a lady in a nearby car. Probably not a guest, as he kissed her when she left. Did not like waiting. Front desk clerk seemed annoyed that I was there. Apologized to her for my interruption. Did not know hotel was undergoing renovation (web site only mentioned lobby). Food and beverage service now offered in hotel conference room. Average room with view of construction site next door. Probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, modern hotel. Well located for LAX.”
Reviews.Author: PopcoReviews
Reviews.Content: 3 nights on a business trip, the hotel is very close to LAX wit a comp shuttle running back and forth to airport every 15 minutes. The lobby has a fantastic arrangment of small work desks complete with power sockets so ideal for small meetings. The bedroom was well appointed, spacious and modern, the bed was one of the best I had slept on for a long time. My only 2 complaints would be that my room did not get serviced until very late in the afternoon also the hotel lacks a restaurant, there is a small deli serving limited items along with Starbucks coffee but I found this was only useful for breakfast, lunch and dinner I decided to visit the hotel next door. Overall a good stay and I would deffinatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and functional”
Reviews.Author: travlife
Reviews.Content: Loved our updated modern room. Lots of usable space. Large sink area outside of toilet ,tub area. Very attractive. Friendly helpful staff. 24 hr snack bar . Shop with food and drinks. Microwave for guests use. Refrigerator and safe in room. Exercise room and outdoor whirlpool. Definitely easy for Hertz car return and airport shuttle. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big, new, clean room, super fast check in....”
Reviews.Author: slj_10
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 12.30 am, two desks were open and serving customers when I walked in, another desk was opened and I was checked in very quickly - at 12.30am!! Clearly a well run facility that understands what a traveller needs after a long day. Room was recently renovated in a zenish Japanese style, while the materials used were on the cheap side (cotton/poly linen & towels, plastic wood) it was all very tasteful. The room is very well lit, has a safe, fridge, iron/board and a huge flat screen (42?). Apart from being spotlessly clean it was also pretty big (I'll post some photos) and I particularly liked the king + sofa bed layout - super practical. Free shuttle bus & wifi and a 24hr snack/amenity shop made for a very convenient short stay. One negative would be that the proximity to the airport meant I could hear planes but not enough to disturb me... Previously stayed at the 4points and the Holiday Inn - for my money this was streets ahead. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover”
Reviews.Author: rusty1818
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel after a long flight and then again on departure . It is just great !!!!! Rooms are recently remodeled ,spacious and clean with a very comfortable bed. I was surprised to find this gem. We came into LA after a long flight and they have a shuttle from the airport to the hotel so it was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay! Very Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: pickylady35
Reviews.Content: I drove across country east to west coast and stayed at quite a number of hotels along the way. I always research where I am going to stay via trip advisor. This was booked at the last minute because I had to stay additional night and the prices were right. They have nice, large and beautiful rooms. Beautiful bathroom, linen etc. I loved the shower curtain what a great touch versus the standard white. Clean, clean, clean! When I come into a room I check bathroom, strip bed, check mattress, check air-condition/heater, closet etc. All was in good order. Best hotel of all during my trip. Check in went very fast, nice young man at front desk greeted me with smile and very professional. You have to do valet if you stay there. The valet man was very nice and when I came down to check out my car was sitting in front ready to go I did not even have to call. I like my car was right outside so I could get anything I forgot. I also like that they have security that can see your car. I ate dinner late at their bistro. I did not expect too much because it was not a full restaurant but I was pleasantly surprised. Service was nice and quick when taking order; Food came fast and was hot and so good!) I would just go back for the food!) My sister thought the food was pricey but if good who cares. She loved her food too. All the people there were great. Overall nice job. I hope they keep this hotel nice. Free Business center with printer (check) Clean and beautifully appointed room (check) Free Wi-Fi in room (check) Nice, welcoming and professional staff in all areas--front desk, food services and valet (check) No noise slept very well (check) Free Airport Shuttle (check) Wake Up call (check) Food onsite and good (check) Beautiful Lounge area to hang out, eat and relax. No drinks in lobby or at bar (check) Parking with security (check) although charge 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Upgrades, but not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bknsf
Reviews.Content: This courtyard features Mariott's new lobby layout - very functional, love the 24hr "convenience store", and upgraded rooms with dark chocolate furniture. Overall, a very nice look. That said, a couple of minor problems prevent me from giving a 5 star rating. First, the bathroom does not have a fan?? Helpful for the obvious reason, but also for venting the shower steam. Additionally, the sink faucet fits "oddly" over the sink so that water is easily spread across the counter getting other items wet, and the iron in the closet is set so high, there's only a small amount of space to pull it out. I'm sure they'll have a hole in there in a couple of months from people pulling it in and out. And not related to the upgrades, watch out for the REQUIRED $14/day valet fee. I was aware of it upfront, but still don't like it. Also, no pool available, so not really "kid friendly". Overall, a very nice hotel, and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels around the world are always pricey and you often don't get what you pay for. The Courtyard has been renovated and it's definitely worth your money for an airport hotel. The shuttle is shared with Marriott LAX from the airport and comes around every 15 minutes. I had stayed at Marriott LAX before and I think Courtyard as bigger rooms. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a new clean renovated hotel at a reasonable price at LAX. It may not have a restaurant or bar, but it has a small bistro open for breakfast and dinner. The hotel also had Advance Car Rental on site so you can rent a car to go out and about if you wish without having to go back tot the airport to get another bus to the car rental places. Staff are all nice and friendly here. Room was quiet and not as noisy as the Marriott LAX as they have thinner walls and connecting doors. My only gripe is I wish the laundry was cleaner. Fitness room was spotless though. Will definitely come back again for a stopover connecting flights.

Reviews.Title: “convenient airport hotel - these guys are pros (and pretty cool, too)”
Reviews.Author: demoizelle
Reviews.Content: Spent a whopping 5 hours at this hotel but they were the most convenient, hassle-free 5 hours we could have hoped for leading up to our flight back home. Had a very late check in (no problem) with good AAA rate, had plenty of PCs and printer stations to print out our boarding passes (super convenient), shuttle driver was pumped and ready at 6am to get people to the terminal asap, and coffee was brewed and ready. Rooms are what you expect - cookie cutter but clean and modern. Wouldn't necessarily plan an extended stay here since they cater to the traveler on-the-go but kudos to the Courtyard for helping end our trip on good note.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: I usually avoid Marriotts, but bidding at Priceline sent me to this one. I stayed for a few hours between flights in the summer of 2010. Receptionist was wonderful. Room was clean and attractively-decorated. Bed was very comfortable. All of this for just $45 -- really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Mario1986
Reviews.Content: Our hotel experience started great with the convenient shuttle from the airport. Upon arriving to the hotel, we immediately noticed that the hotel was very nice and clean. Additionally, the employees were very welcoming and provided us with outstanding service. To highlight this outstanding service, after Cathy finished checking us in, I asked her a question regarding taxi or any other service for my husband to Long Beach the next day to pick up our truck at the ports and she said she would get us the info. By the time we got to our room she had left a message with info. Also I was going by looking for some other info and the manager approached me to see he could help. Even at the food and bar area the employees were nice. Everyone conducted themselves very professional and always with a smile. Rooms were very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Saved my vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ajcloward
Reviews.Content: This place saved me from a horrible experience at a hostel. I only stayed there one night and had to get out, and found this hotel on priceline. Although using such sites won't guarantee you this location. I was amazed that it was actually CHEAPER than a private room at the hostel. After staying at the disgusting hostel, walking into the Courtyard felt like a palace! I gasped when I opened my room and saw how enormous it was and absolutely beautifully decorated. Fully stocked "mini store" in the lobby that could have almost anything you would ever need at all hours. Reasonably priced adult beverages at the Bistro as well. I was also shocked that the internet was both wired and wireless (your choice) and it was free. Not many hotels of this caliber offer free internet. I highly recommend this place, especially for travelers. Rent a car and then stay here no matter where your vacation or business takes you into the LA area. When you're ready to fly back home, you're within less than 5 minutes from the airport...and as busy as LAX is, you need to be there AT LEAST 2 hours before your departure. Being so close will give you extra sleep on the amazingly comfortable beds. This is my new regular hotel for every future visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: regaffman
Reviews.Content: Stay one night at arrival night. Everything was good. Good place to stay at the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nicely Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: PromoRoadGuy
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay here. It's close to LAX which can be convenient depending on your trip, though I didn't hear any jet noise at all. You wouldn't know you were next door to a major airport by listening. My room was recently remodeled and very well decorated and appointed for a hotel of this class. Updated TV, new furniture, etc. The lobby has been very recently remodeled and was very comfortable and stylish. It's so recently done that in fact the cafe opens for the first time tonight. There are many places to meet, with high- and low-top tables scattered about with plenty of outlets. Very business friendly There is no pool, but there is a small outdoor space with a whirlpool. The fitness center is small but serviceable. There are two elliptical machines, two treadmills and a recumbent bike along with a bench and a few dumbbells. One of the ellipticals and one of the treadmills were very new and high end, the other two were older but still workable. Unfortunately the nicer elliptical and the older treadmill were out of order when I was there, but they assure me that they're in the process of being fixed. Towels and small bottles of water are provided. The older machines were a little dirty unfortunately. Free high speed internet, both wired and wifi. I didn't test the speeds but they were fast enough that I didn't think to. Valet-only parking at a rate of $18/day. There is a ramp next door if you want to go that route.

Reviews.Title: “Good except for the renovations”
Reviews.Author: baysyd1
Reviews.Content: We overnighted here in April. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet, the small restaurant was fine and the staff were most helpful. The hotel was very convenient for LAX and the free shuttle buses worked well arriving and leaving. The only problem was the renovations which were taking place. They were only a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, even during remodel”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyRvwr
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel for an overnight stay while visiting UCLA. This hotel came up as a good value, perhaps because they are currently undergoing a major renovation project. The reservation page and the front desk informs you about the remodel, and if you don't stay in the room during the day, it's not a problem. The lobby was blocked off during my stay, but the inconvenience was kept to a minimum. I got one of the rooms that had already been remodeled, which was great, comfortable, spacious, and clean. My only nit is that it has gone with the trend of no towel bars in the bathroom, which I think would become inconvenient with more than 1 guest in the room. No pool (at least during my stay, but share with Marriott down the street). Yes, the shared shuttle from LAX is a little circuitous, so account for that in your time planning. I ended up self-parking in the Quickpark next door, which is cheaper than valet and their shuttle is more direct than the shared hotel shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot the wake up call”
Reviews.Author: SnaveSydney
Reviews.Content: Disappointed by this hotel. Doing renovations in the lobby when we stayed so check in very cramped. Check in staff oozed the pseudo-sincere welcome that the Americans are masters of. Made us feel quite uncomfortable. Made to sign disclaimer form about any disturbance caused by the renovations. Actually they didn't disturb us but if they were that worried about it, maybe we should have been told before we booked. Room large, clean and comfortable. Shuttle transport is shared with other hotels but was OK. We had an early morning flight and they committed what I would consider a cardinal sin for an airport hotel of forgetting our wake up call. Our alarm woke us so no harm done but still not very impressive. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you plan to use the complimentary airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: ATP1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during a recent vacation -- both as overnight stopovers while changing flights at LAX. I have stayed at this hotel before for business. I want to give this hotel a higher rating, but I simply can't because of the EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING complimentary airport shuttle service. In fact, despite being satisfied with the condition of the hotel and our room, we will not stay here again because of the airport shuttle service. The primary reason we chose this hotel was because of its proximity to LAX and because the hotel's website indicated that a shuttle came by every 15 minutes. Don't believe it! On both occasions, we waited at the curb for a very long time before the shuttle arrived. Other hotels' shuttle busses passed two or three times before our shuttle bus came. Since it happened twice, I don't view this as an isolated instance. Also, when the shuttle finally came, it said it is shared by the Sheraton, Embassy Suites, and Courtyard in order to be kinder to the environment. Our first stop was the Sheraton. To add insult to injury, after we left the Sheraton, the shuttle drove right by the Courtyard hotel and drove several blocks to the Embassy Suites before then circling back to the Courtyard. I do not know what is environmentally-friendly about that route. This is really too bad because just about everything else at the hotel met my expectations for a Marriott property at this level -- basic but clean & spacious rooms. The bed was comfortable, and our room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for a LAX Sleep-Over”
Reviews.Author: SandBTokyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a night's stop-over at LAX, arriving at 9 PM with a 7 AM flight. The hotel is very close to LAX, minutes away by free shuttle which services the hotel every 15 minutes 24/7. The staff was friendly and efficient. The hotel is clean, quiet and arranged for convenient. They had a bar and restaurant, as well as a small snack shop. The room was small, but comfortable and easy internet hookup. Our rate was reasonable, $99.00. It was easy and trouble-free, which is exactly what I was looking for. So, for a place to sleep at LAX, this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: annedr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel due to its location at airport and the fact that we had an early morning flight. Room was clean and comfortable. Location was great for our needs. Staff was attentive and friendly. Had free internet use in lobby. Small restaurant and bar but didn't use either. Charge for parking. Shuttle was efficient, timely and free. Additionally. We had gotten a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: paris1949
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at this hotel and can certainly recommend it. The hotel shuttle bus was easy to find on the arrivals level of the airport terminal and the ride to the hotel was only about 5 minutes. Check-in was quick and efficient and our room was large, quiet, spacious, well equipped and clean. We used room service for some food following a late arrival at the hotel and while the food was a bit pricey, as others have commented, it was good. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mann_mm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to LAX (about 10 minutes shuttle ride) and the shuttle is 24/7. It is good for me to arrive LA at late late night and catch another flight at early morning. And the price is extremly valuable as I found that I can enjoy a very very very low room price (US$ 90 for a night - tax included) when I become one of the member of Marriott Reward!!! The room is very very very BIG. The shower is great, it helped me to relax from the tired 14 hours flight. And the free internet is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: This is my hotel of choice in the LA area. The rooms are spacious, the hotel is quiet and the internet service is reliable and free. Just not enough praises for this hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for an overnight stay just before a flight. it is close to the airport and offers all you need at a reasonable rate. Had a good selection of snacks from the cafe for late check in meals. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle service to the airport works well and if you want to go to the beach there is a trolley service available at a minimum fee.

Reviews.Title: “great transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: rini47
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for overnight transit passengers as hotel provides free airport shuttle- the pickup is just outside baggage claim so very easy to find. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The best feature is the provision of complimentary tea and coffee facilities in the room and even in other lobby areas. There is a buffet breakfast from 0630am at a charge. Highly recommended for transit stays.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose, but no frills”
Reviews.Author: worksuckstravelmore
Reviews.Content: Flew in late night to LAX with a flight to Maui early the next morning. The highlight of the few hours that we were there was that my husband convinced the shuttle driver to take him to In-N-Out for take out (in exchange he bought the driver a burger). What a meal! But I digress. You can definitely tell that this an airport hotel...people coming and going at crazy hours, and most of all rooms that are turned over many times. The furniture, carpet, and bathrooms were definitely showing wear. I would think that this place gets enough business to refresh it from time to time. You can smell the "oldness" in the hallways. But the bed, tub, and sink were clean no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Dvine1_Cali
Reviews.Content: I don't ask for much. I just want to be treated like a valued customer. Once it was my turn to check in the front desk clerk almost seemed to be going out of his way to not help me, i.e. taking calls, not talking to me, etc. He didn't even apologize. When I mentioned the obvious and asked him to help me, instead of being helpful, he upped the ante on being a jerk. I was busy and didn't talk to management because of my schedule but I would've if I had had more time. I even passed by him walking in the hallway later and he practically gave me the evil eye, even though he was the one who was out of line. Totally unacceptable, Marriott. Not coming back here. I will go where I am appreciated, and where they have better trained staff. Marriots always seem to vary a lot in terms of the quality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Chrgrs4eva
Reviews.Content: I honestly didn't expect much from this hotel for the price. It definately exceeded my expectations. My room was very clean and it seemed like it had been recently updated. I had a good sleep on the bed (most hotel beds are too hard!) For breakfast I tried the cafe/restaurant. They did my eggs exactly how I ordered them. When I went to check out I missed my shuttle but another one came soon after so I was not late for my flight. Overall great value here.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job fine but thatÂ´s all”
Reviews.Author: Bicholisto
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reviews already so IÂ´ll keep it short. Free shuttle (the one for Courtyard NOT Marriott), quick, courteous check in, close to airport (but shuttle took a while stopping elsewhere thus removing any advantage of proximity to airport). The building is nothing special and neither was our room: clean and spacious but dated and slightly depressing. Reminded me of the CA state road system: in need of infrastructural reinvestment. And why do so many US hotels still use sheets and blankets instead of duvets? Beyond me. Breakfast was fine. Price overall too high. Surrounding area uninviting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the night before a flight”
Reviews.Author: Sukibot
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice for a place to stay before an early flight. Room was clean and comfortable with free wifi. Nice bathroom for a big, long shower after a tiring drive. Only small issue was a high-pitched noise squealed intermittently. My husband guessed it was the smoke detector and pushed the button and the sound stopped for the duration of our sleep. It started again the next morning, but we didnâ€™t care at that point. Restaurant was so-so, so it may be worth your while to find a good restaurant. We were too tired from driving so we were stuck with the hotel restaurant. They have PCs with printers so easy to print out your boarding passes. Only one warning: their instructions for getting to the Alamo rental place are wrong. Doublecheck them against a map.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a layover”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in late September at the rate of $169 + taxes. Itâ€™s a layover hotel and all the things you want in such a hotel are there. The shuttle works well. Itâ€™s extremely close to the airport (almost quicker to walk than go by shuttle if you are in the higher numbered terminals) and there are various food options in the vicinity. For example, there is a subway more or less next door. The hotel itself is fine, the rooms comfortable (although, as others have commented, they have a â€˜differentâ€™ layout with the closet acting as a room divider and the basin/vanity area being in the room rather than the bathroom) and the wifi works fine. Do not have complimentary coffee in the lobby â€“ which I thought was mandatory for a Courtyard. I didnâ€™t get a chance to explore the gym or other facilities and left before breakfast! Iâ€™d happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you need to stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: PBBear
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay near LAX, I don't think you could do better than this hotel. It's no frills, but really, if you do need to stay next to the airport, you probably aren't looking for any either. As others have mentioned, there are two Marriotts in the area. Best not to even call this one "Marriott." Just think of it as Courtyard Century Blvd (yes, a mouth full). Be clear on this when you get on the airport shuttle. PROS: LOCATION: I can't say for certain, but I think it might be the closest hotel to LAX. There is also a free shuttle that runs every 15 minutes or so. No problems getting to or from the airport. There are several eateries within walking distance. LOBBY: Very nice. In fact, I was surprised at how comfortable it was. Maybe it's because the hotel is right off Century, you expect something else, but once you get inside, it's nice and quiet. Almost peaceful. They have a dining and bar area as well as business center with TWO computers, so no (or very little) waiting. STAFF: Very friendly and helpful. No problems here. ROOM: No frills, but a very nice design. I liked the fact that there is a little divider (also used as a mini closet), that sort of separates the sleeping area from the desk/chairs area. They also fitted in a love seat. The bed was very comfortable. No view, but again, I don't that would be of importance to anyone needing to stay next to the airport. Room was clean. Vanity area is outside the bathroom. VALUE: We got our room for 79.00 plus tax. Great deal. CONS: NONE. We will definitely stay here again if we need a place near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and close to LAX airport, good for overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: habib2nv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way back from Canada to Australia and was well impressed. Nice and close to the airport, convenient free shuttle bus picks you up from the airport and also takes you back when you're leaving. Had one negative even before we got there, I was at LAX using a payphone and I called the hotel to ask how we get there with the free shuttle and the guy on the phone explained to me "where and when" but was quick to transfer me to someone else when I started to clarify the info he gave me... he didn't even ask me to hold, just shot me over to someone else!! Overall, very friendly staff, who will go out of their way to help you out, especially with bags, but then again I guess that gives them a reason to earn a tip from people. Room was very clean and huge, as was the bed, nice living/office area seperated by the wardrobes. Just find it strange as a typical American hotel having the basin in the room and not in the bathroom, but still, wasn't a problem. Excellent and comfortable bed, had a really nice sleep, short as it was, and they also gave us late check-out till 3.00pm which you usually have to move heaven and earth to get a midday check-out anywhere else!! Had their buffet breaky the next morning, usual and typical hotel breakfast, was filling and didn't make you feel sick like most places. Had a cook making eggs to order which I found really good, and they also had a waffle maker in the breakfast area where you pour the batter in yourself and make giant waffles hehe. Will definitely stay here again due to location and if the price is right. We went for a few hours to Venice beach, was a $20.00 cab ride, so not too bad instead of fussing around with public transport, plus it was a Saturday so buses were limited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: gtgraf
Reviews.Content: Nice clean Marriott property. It was great for our 4am free shuttle to the airport (shuttle runs 24 hours/day). We also were able to walk down the street to another hotel which had three restuarants to choose from. This hotel also had a nice looking restuarant but we just needed the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly quiet, considering it's right next to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea-v-Inter
Reviews.Content: July 19-21, 2009 Important: There are TWO Marriott hotels on West Century Blvd near LAX. If you hop on the airport shuttle, make sure you know which one you are going to. I said "Marriott" when the driver asked where we were headed, and he took us to the Marriott. Unfortunately, it was the wrong one. Luckily, the other is literally just down the street and our driver was very kind enough to drop us there - I imagine he gets this ALL the time, especially when travellers arrive in the middle of the night. The friendly staff provided our room quickly and we were amazed at how quiet it was inside the lobby, given that the hotel is right beside one of the busiest airports in the USA. When the thick glass sliding doors of the lobby close, the noise stays out - impressive. The next morning, we had a reasonable breakfast for a reasonable price. A chef prepares made-to-order omelettes, which were fresh and flavourful. The rest of the breakfast buffet selections consisted of so-so canteloupe, nice honeydew, and bananas, though I had to ask for some that weren't bruised. The kitchen staff were very happy to get some without hesitation. Again, very impressed. The rest of the breakfast selections were bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, and you-make waffles, cereals, oatmeal, bagels, muffins and toast. There was a menu to order from as well. The room was very clean and fresh smelling. The vanity is outside of the bathroom - handy when you don't want a foggy mirror; not so handy when you want to the keep the room light off while others are still sleeping. What is it with hotel showerheads? Do they HAVE to be at chest level?? I'm 6'1", so I'm not exactly a giant. Though the bathroom has a 8' ceiling, why can't they raise the showerhead up so I don't have to duck awkwardly to shower. The hot water may be generated by an instant-on system. Periodically throughout every shower we had, the water would become scaldingly hot for 3 seconds, then return to normal. It wasn't someone in an adjoining room using the water because it was very regular in the way it happened. It was easy enough to step out of the stream of water for the few seconds it took to return to normal, but the first time it happened was a shock. The business center was accessible and easy to use - and they didn't charge $1.00 per sheet of printer paper, like another hotel I stayed at that week. The exercise room was small, but very clean and well equipped - three treadmills, a recumbant, and an elliptical - all with TVs attached, along with a free weight rack and lots of towels and free water bottles. The room could use better air movement or some fans. My daughter and I made good use of the treadmills and we were pouring buckets by the end of our run. Staff throughout were very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff provided directions to various locations and recommended the trolley / shuttle to Manhatten Beach. For $3.00 (I think), the shuttle will take you to a nice beach, and pick you up later. You can also get dropped off at two small popular malls - all on the same ticket! Great deal!! After our two nights in LA, we were going to Pasadena to see a big soccer match. To reduce travel time late at night after the match, we stayed in Pasadena. Although we had checked out of the Marriott, we came back the following day when we dropped off our rental car next door. We still had several hours before our flight left, and we asked the front desk staff if we could leave our bags in the Bell room. The very friendly staff allowed us to store our luggage and sit in the restaurant/lobby to relax. We had some snacks, hot chocolate, tea, and caught a little ESPN while we prepared to leave LA. If you need a quiet, reasonably-priced hotel near LAX with friendly staff - this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location, Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lor_Family
Reviews.Content: I paid under $100 Cdn for this hotel and was very pleased. When we arrived the carpets in the lobby were being cleaned which showed me a sense of care. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our room was right by the elevator and I thought that might be a problem with people flying in and out through the wee hours but not one of us heard anything. Rooms were quiet, nice size, clean and very comfortable. Location was perfect as we were flying out early and needed to be gone by 5:30 am. I would not be able to create a list of anything I didn't like, a slight disappointment was that I didn't know up front that you had to use valet parking, maybe I am a naive traveller though. Did that ruin my stay though... not at all!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, just enough for a LAX layover”
Reviews.Author: Plan-it-chick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean. The staff are courteous. The shuttle and proximity to LAX is why I chose this hotel. Be forewarned that the shuttle also picks up from other hotels on its route back to the airport. I took a 5:00am shuttle that was jam packed. Luckily they had another shuttle right behind the one I was on to pick up the other hotel guests waiting. The only place to eat was the hotel restaurant which was high priced. They had a small walk in closet "snack bar" store located behind the hotel lobby desk that was worthless. My advice is to get a taxi and go eat somewhere else. I went to Inn and Out Burger for the first time. It is within walking distance. The room was nice except the bathtub was a bit small and I'm only 5'5". All in all a good stay but a bit overpriced for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: krazee1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and convenient and satisfied all our requirements. The staff were courteous with one gentleman providing good service. However, another lady on the front desk was quite abrupt and could not even tell us how to get to Hollywood via public transport. The rooms were nice and in excellent condition. Free wi-fi in the rooms was great. Breakfast was ok, for a fee. A blue shuttle bus from the airport was very convenient and quite regular. The hotel is just a minute's walk from the tourist trolley bus which passes Manhattan Beach and Manhattan Village shopping area, providing easy access to both sights and shops. Note that the trolley bus runs with limited hours during non-summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed!”
Reviews.Author: morgana2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a for a stopover on the way to and from New Zealand. We stayed one night and then another three weeks later. We had a king room and it was set up differently from any other hotel room I have seen. The closets served as a room divider with the bed and a sofa on one side and the desk/table, sink, bathroom on the other. It was pretty convenient if one person wants to sleep and the other wants to watch tv or work. The service was great. On the way to NZ our flight did not leave until 9:30pm. The hotel gave us a later check out of 3pm, then held our bags while we took the shuttle to manhattan beach for a late lunch/dinner. We also ordered room service from their small restaurant. It was served in a timely manner, was reasonably priced and was quite good. The shuttle to/from the airport was convenient and on time. For a hotel so close to the airport, it was very quiet. We'd definitely recommend this as an airport hotel.... it probably isn't for longer stays as there is not much in the neighborhood except the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Juiced_Pixels
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel close to LAX airport, easily accessible by free shuttle. We arrived at 7am and were given our room straight away, we had well over 24 hours in our room which was excellent value at $90 we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vattu
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Courtyard hotel between long distance flights. The hotel was excellent for this purpose: it was easy to get to the hotel and back to the airport with the free shuttle bus (duration of the journey around 10-15 minutes), the rooms were large, silent, very comfortable & in great condition, and the breakfast was good. Tips: The shuttle bus picks customers at each terminal under the red sign. There are also plenty of other shuttles stopping at the same stop, and it's good to know that the name of the hotel is in this context "Courtyard" (there is another hotel called Marriott LAX). The same bus also serves two other nearby hotels, and the hotel names are shown in front of the bus. The buffet breakfast costed 10-13 dollars, and was very nice. We also visited Disneyland between the flights which was quite easy to reach with first shuttle bus to airport and then with another shuttle bus to Disneyland (19 dollars and 40 minutes) from the airport green sign stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel choice Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SouthMauiGuy
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Great Service Great Location The staff were great The windows are the double paned and double sliders Road and airport noise was non existent Loved this hotel!!!priceline 41 dollars WOW

Reviews.Title: “Two Great Stays...”
Reviews.Author: Kim54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a night in January, and then three weeks later, a night in February. We were headed to Australia/New Zealand and wanted to break up the trip from our home in Florida. We did not want to rent a car for 1 day each way. The shuttle service was prompt--every 15 minutes to/from the airport. The front desk was wonderful. Our room was very nice, and they had free wireless. We used their free business center to print our boarding passes. Both days, we used the Manhatten Beach Trolley to get out and about. It was nice to hit the beach, and eat out. Three dollars round trip per person--a great deal! Courtyard also accomodated our requests for late-checkout, and early check-in due to the timing of our international flights. All in all--two great stays. Thank you Marroitt Courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, rooms in desparate need of upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: islandmap
Reviews.Content: After staying in several Courtyards over the years, I anticipated consistent room quality that you would expect from a Marriott. This hotel does not meet that expectation. Good points: Location to LAX and friendly staff. Large room with nice layout. Free internet access. Bad points: Noise from elevators, street noise and plumbing noise. Scratchy sheets that don't quite fit the bed, Unvacuumed floor next to bed. Old, cheap pillows. Furniture in major need of upgrades. If you don't mind sleeping on a mattress with sheets coming off around you, this is the hotel for you. Major disappointment after reading the positive reviews on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THJ
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is really close to the airport - shuttle bus took about 5 minutes to get there from LAX. Very welcoming bell and front desk staff. After a long flight it's great to feel that they appreciate you being there - and the staff here REALLY did. We were shown to our room which was next to the elevators on the 6th floor - I'm a very fussy sleeper but I swear I didn't hear a thing all night. The rooms are soundproofed to a very high standard both internally and externally. You don't hear any planes. Room very comfortable with everything you could need - free internet access, great shower etc. Decent dining in the hotel for both dinner and the following morning's breakfast. I'd have NO hesititation in using this hotel again - really good stay made extra special by the staff particularly Alex on the front desk who couldn't do enough. Great ambassador for the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: burrowsydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, one in September and the other in October. The purpose was to break up the flights from Hong Kong to Chicago and Las Vegas to Hong Kong. The hotel and the staff were excellent, both rooms clean, the first, a handicapped persons,as another wasn't ready upon check in, was larger and consequently more comfortable than the latter. The reason for booking a hotel at LAX was to be close to the airport and the considerations were hotel quality and lack of aircraft noise. Courtyard was excellent on both counts, shuttle bus very convenient, cookies and apples at reception a bonus. As the LA Destination Experts advised there is not a lot to do in the LAX environs and it is not convenient for public transport however, as a stopover, and as we'd toured LA years ago, the location was fine. It is a 15 minutes walk up Sepulveda to In and Out, Ralphs, a pharmacy, Starbucks, Togos and other small restaurants. We also took the trolley bus shuttle to Manhattan Beach and a couple of nearby malls, $3.00 per person round trip. No problem in recommending the Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Pruski
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Courtyard. Was a great place for stopover. Nice big rooms, comfy beds and great reception staff. Welcomed and well looked after. Breakfast waffles were awesome too! Next time in LA will stay there again! Great value for money! And the spa is an added bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: StuMoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Courtyard Marriot LAX on Century Boulevard in September 2008, the start of a 14 night trip around Nevada/California. As we arrived in LA from London late in the afternoon, and our first destination was Las Vegas, we decided it would be best to stay overnight near the airport and drive the long drive to Vegas the next morning. There is a Hertz depot at the Marriott on Century Boulevard which is 5 minutes walk from the Courtyard - so we left our bags in the room in the morning, went and collected the car, then drove back and picked up the luggage. Doing this, rather than picking the car up from Hertz LAX saved us a days rental cost, plus the $15 parking fee Courtyard charge. Arrival: There is a complimentary shuttle bus from the airport terminal. After a 10 minute wait the bus came along (they do constant circuits) and picked us up. The five minute journey was comfortable and we were deposited right outside the lobby door. The receptionist was very friendly and attentive, and the whole check-in procedure took 5 minutes. The lobby is clean and nicely decorated. The Room: Our room was on the 2nd floor. It overlooked a construction site (hey, you don't book airport hotels for the views) but the windows were so well insulated that even a jack-hammer across the street failed to cause noise. It was a deluxe room with King size bed. The bed was very comfortable, with plenty of pillows. Room size was good, there was a desk (with internet available free via a cable) and two chairs in a 'study' area - seperated from the main part of the room by a large wardrobe. The room also featured a sink, coffee maker, a sofa and a decent sized television. Overall, very comfortable and well appointed. Hotel Facilities: As we were tired after a 12 hour flight, we really could not be bothered seeking out restaurants, so were pleased that the hotel has its own cafe style affair. The food was good - we pizza and a club sandwich - the staff pleasant and attentive and the cost not too bad. There is a small shop next to the reception desk selling snacks, toiletries etc. We didn't use any other facilities. Check-out As mentioned, we collected our rental car prior to checking out and the valet was happy for us to temporarily park out front (at no cost) whilst we got our luggage from the room. The hotel post the bill under your door, so if you want to you can simply drop the key in the box and go - they'll charge your credit card. We went to the desk and handed in the key, the receptionist was again very pleasant and seemed genuinely interested to know if everything had been ok for us. Overall An excellent hotel. Very well located close to the airport - though there is not much else in Century Blvd (other than hotels) if you are staying more than a night. Very comfortable, good staff and whilst not cheap, it is competitively priced for the area. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: I liked the property, and would stay here again. 10 minute wait for a free shuttle, five minutes from the hotel. Staff was consistently friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with in-room coffee and separate sink from bath/shower. The TV was old and should be updated. Dinner and breakfast both very good. I never heard a single airplane despite the proximity to LAX. Finally, if you have a little time on your hands, the $3 roundtrip shuttle bus down to Manhattan Beach is a bargain - see the ocean, walk the pier, shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: housekeeping30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a long haul flight and before a very early flight the next day. Room was a good size and clean.Easy walk to the bus terminal and easily caught a bus to Venice Beach and Santa Monica. Also a fairly easy walk over to the famous In & Out Burger Place. Shuttle to the terminals quite frequesnt but does go via a few properties along the way. Free internet a big plus and staff seemed pleasant. I would not stay if visiting LA but if you are needing to be near LAX a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for its price range”
Reviews.Author: zeffer_NY
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this Courtyard: * It's the closest hotel to the airport. You could walk there from the terminal (if you didn't mind walking down a freeway ramp!) Some other hotel shuttle rides are quite long, which can be annoying after a long flight. * The staff were superbly helpful. * A fridge in the room. I'm still amazed at how few supposedly fancy American hotels don't have fridges in the rooms! * Free high-speed internet access in the room. Yes, FREE. Hotels at twice the price often charge $19.99 a day. So deduct that from the room cost. * Room was very clean, modern and spacious. It looked recently renovated: nothing musty or moldy. And surprisingly quiet. * Nice strong shower. The only downside is... this is technically a 2.5-star hotel. It ain't the Four Seasons. So don't go in with huge expectations. But for a quick clean cheap place to stay on a stopover, it's one of the best I've found.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for Location only”
Reviews.Author: superh50
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for one night before my flight so the Courtyard sufficed. It's not a bad place--rooms are clean and comfortable, bathroom is fine but both are quite small. The exercise room hardly lives up to its name however the pool is actually large and usually empty. Pretty much, only stay here in a pinch given the five minute drive to LAX. I took a video of the hotel room, lobby and amenities so if you want to see for yourself, you can watch here: http://www.tripfilms.com/Travel_Video-v64424-Los_Angeles-The_Courtyard_Marriott-Video.html

Reviews.Title: “Just the Job”
Reviews.Author: bloggs047
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 1 night after landing in LAX. Its in a great location in that its very close to the airport and also quite close to the car rental places too. Check-in was easy and the staff were all friendly and welcoming. The room was a good size and quite clean - not spotless like some of the other reviewers said though, the bathroom could have done with a bit more of a clean! However, it was a nice spacious comfortable room. We didn't experience too much noise. Yes, you can hear the odd rumble of planes but then you are right next to the airport so what else can be expected?!? It really wasn't an issue though and certainly didn't disturb us in any way. There was internet access at 2 computers in the lobby area which was great - and free! I've rated it a 3 out of 5 which feels slightly harsh as there wasn't anything wrong with it, but it just didn't do anything special enough to go up a notch to "above average" unfortunately! Overall, I would stay at this hotel again though, mainly because its so convenience for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dude, where's my stuff?”
Reviews.Author: mrsisaak
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the Courtyard LAX until I went back to the room and all my stuff was GONE! I called the front desk to find out that housekeeping had taken my stuff (apparently thinking I had checked out - ???) and that no one had access to it. I had a flight early the next day - before housekeeping came back - so I couldn't get my things back. Luckily I had taken my bag with my car/house keys and ID with me that day so I didn't have a security problem at the airport or a problem getting into my house or car but ?????. The best they could do was mail my stuff back to me. How does that happen????

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly quiet for LAX”
Reviews.Author: Davooda
Reviews.Content: At the end of a long business trip in March 2008 I needed a quiet place to rest. I shuddered to think that I needed to book a room near LAX because of an early flight but booked it anyway. The Courtyard LAX was a very pleasant surprise. The room was comfy, clean and very quiet - just what I needed. The rate was also very competitive so I will most likely be back!

Reviews.Title: “close to LAX, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for 1 night near LAX. It was very very close So close you could walk to the LAX sign (terminals you can't walk technically). Free hotel shuttle - drops off to other hotel first but runs every 15 minutes. Good rate and nice luxury hotel. Room was nice and large. I had a King sized bed - separated by a wall of storage cabinets from the door and desk. Sink was outside from toilet and shower. Refrigerator under the sink. More storage over the tv Bed was comfortable. TV was in an odd place but could watch it comfortably from the bed Downside - noise from the hallway - I could hear the elevator ding, doors closing, and people in the hallway, not soundproof at all. A plus - I barely heard the airplanes - just a very dull roar - hardly noticed so the soundproof to outside was a plus. Also felt very safe. Next to the front desk - had a small area that sold sodas, drinks, snacks - open 24 hours. Staff at desk was friendly and mentioned where to find breakfast for a cost. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a hotel near LAX

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: juliewillgreg
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Just steps from the baggage claim. Convenient shuttle to and from airport. Spacious and very clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, not like what reviewers say it is”
Reviews.Author: anon45525
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last night after reading the reviews about how quiet it was. I was very disappointed. This may be the quietest one in LAX, but you can definitely hear the LOUD, low frequency rumbling of the planes on takeoff and landing. The plane noise occurs about every 5 minutes in the evening. All of these reviewers must have been on some kind of medication to make these kinds of statements, since this was obviously not the case. If you need to stay near the airport, stay in El Segundo. This is not a full service hotel/restaurant and the staff tells you if you need something to go next door to the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: fresgal
Reviews.Content: First of all, thanks to all of my fellow Trip Advisor contributors! I rely heavily upon your honest reviews in making my hotel selections, and it really pays off. Thank you! I went to Los Angeles just because I wanted to get out of town for my birthday. I stayed at the Courtyard November 11th through the 13th. I love Marriott hotels, and the Courtyard definitely lives up to Marriott's standards. I booked a standard room through a major online merchant's travel service for a mere $108 per night, compared to the regular rate of $199 per night. I love a good bargain! Lynnette at the front desk was very helpful. After I had made my reservation with an online service, there was a long delay (almost two weeks) in the hotel receiving my reservation information, and Lynnette called me when my reservation was entered into their computer system. I had read negative stories about the Courtyard's airport shuttle service, but I figured I could endure that in exchange for staying at the Courtyard. It turns out that those stories were true. When I arrived at LAX at 10:20 a.m., I called the Courtyard and Veronica told me where to stand next to the airport to wait for the shuttle and that it would arrive within 15 minutes. So I waited where she told me to wait, and a few minutes later I saw a Courtyard shuttle whiz by out on the street, not even coming into the airport area to pick up passengers. I called Veronica and told her what happened, and she apologized and said she would send another shuttle. Believe it or not, the same thing happened! The second shuttle whizzed by out on the street without coming into the passenger area. By this time, I had waited almost 45 minutes for a shuttle. I called Veronica again, and she said to take a taxi and she would reimburse me when I got to the hotel, which she did without hesitation once I got there. During check-in, she apologized once again for the shuttle problems, and then offered me an upgrade to a suite on the sixth floor! Believe me, when I opened the door to my beautiful suite, the shuttle problems were worth the trouble! Everything looked like it was new. The carpet and all the furnishings were in excellent condition. It was more like a one-bedroom apartment than a suite. I loved it! It was my home away from home. The king size bed was so comfortable. I enjoyed the flat screen TV in the bedroom. The spacious bathroom was very clean. The suites are $259 per night, so getting it for just $108 was a steal! One really good benefit of staying at the Courtyard is that it is on the route of the free Ocean Express trolley service that the City of Los Angeles operates to take hotel guests to Manhattan Beach Pier and Manhattan Village Mall. Just walk about half a block from the hotel to the corner and stand in front of the Radisson hotel at the Ocean Express sign, and the trolley will pick up there. It's a free ride, but the drivers welcome tips from riders. It's a fun way to see L.A. and enjoy beautiful ocean scenery. You can get a schedule from the front desk at the Courtyard. Meals at the Courtyard are delicious. It always smells so good throughout the hotel. The breakfast buffet has a good selection of foods. I had three different food servers while I was there. Ellvira was my waitress on Monday morning. She was very nice. She told me she has been working there for a year and a half and likes the Courtyard better than any other hotel restaurant she has worked at in the past. On Monday I went on a sightseeing tour of places like Marina del Rey, Venice Beach, Santa Monica Pier, Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive. By the time I got back to the hotel, I just wanted to go to my room and relax, but my electronic key card wouldn't let me in. I called the front desk, and a manager came with a new key for me. This actually happened three times while I was there, but it was taken care of quickly. On Monday night, Francisco was my waiter. What a guy! Great smile and great service. On Tuesday morning, Monique was my waitress. What a difference between her and the other two wait staff. Her attitude wasn't the greatest. I left her a tip, even though she didn't deserve it. Checking out was as quick and easy as checking in had been. Fortunately, the shuttle going to the airport is much more reliable than the shuttle from the airport! I would gladly stay at the Courtyard again, and I highly recommend it to anyone else staying in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Spacious Room by Airport”
Reviews.Author: rizzay
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night, but I'd go back. Hotel was clean, quiet, simple, centrally located. Room was spacious and had a great vanity-style mirror (perfect for female styling!). Room service was decent-- typical Marriot food-- and staff was friendly. Small bar in the lobby (by small, I mean only a couple of stools), but it's a nice gesture for the loan traveler. Parking was a bit of a pain. Only valet service available and the hotel charges for it ($17, I think?). And while it's a great location for drivers, there is not much in the immediate vicinity to walk to. But Manhattan Beach is right around the corner and you get anywhere from there. Also, the "Business Center" is only 2 computers and a printer, so you should bring your own laptop, unless you want to sit and watch teenagers play on Facebook all day. I felt comfortable in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the room I confirmed”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: I had a king bed confirmed, but when I got to my room there were two doubles. They failed to mention it to me upon check-in, and when I called the front desk from my room they confessed that they were over-sold on kings. They gave me $20 off the bill for compensation. I am a rewards member of their program, and they were aware of this, but apparently that didn't matter. I don't like to be deceived. In addition, the bathroom floor was not as clean as it should have been. For $189 (before the $20 off), I definitely don't think it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Early Flight Solution”
Reviews.Author: NeighborBGood
Reviews.Content: We live in the LA area, had a very early flight, and decided to try staying in a hotel the night before. I narrowed it down to this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, but was sold on it when I found they have a very enticing "Park and Fly" package. When I subtracted the total for parking at our usual nearby lot from the price of the room package, it all made great financial sense, combined with the huge bonus of not waking up at 3:00 am and driving for an hour before our flight. Roomy, quiet (as reviews have said), and so convenient, it's almost magical. Throw in room service dinner, including pizza for the kids, and it was the smoothest night before a trip we've ever had. The Courtyard was the perfect solution, and we'll stay there in the future when we have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: UMichAlum
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is very nice but I find it difficult to belive that it really ranks #14 out of 170+ hotels in Los Angeles. Be that as it may, my stay was comfortable. Being so close to LAX it is amazingly quiet. I never heard a plane. The restaurant (at which I ate breakfast and dinner) is good......not outstanding.....but good. The room was well appointed, the internet connection was good. The front desk, valet parking and restaurant employees were all efficient and friendly. There were not special amenities but the usual were provided. Would I stay there again?
